channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CrowdStrike's Big Mystery: How Bad, and for How Long?
item.description: The cybersecurity provider’s second-quarter results might shed limited light on fallout from the global outage caused by its minor software update.

item.title: ‘I’m conflicted’: I have two sons — one is a hard worker with kids and the other is a ‘carefree’ actor. Should I leave the ‘family man’ more money in my will?
item.description: “The money could be going to my grandkids.”

item.title: Big-Bank CEOs Like to Wield Influence---Except in Presidential Politics
item.description: Top bankers weigh in frequently on issues from immigration to tariffs, but they almost never contribute directly to presidential campaigns.

item.title: German business increasingly in trouble, Ifo survey finds
item.description: Sentiment at German companies edged lower this month, as Europe’s largest economy shows little sign of a recovery amid a persistent manufacturing slum...

item.title: Pay Your Rent, Get 2% Cash Back: Landlords Join Craze for Rewards
item.description: Renters cash in points for colored pencils and get $15 a month for paying rent on time.

item.title: Oprah Winfrey was a hit at the DNC, but her real estate portfolio will really wow you
item.description: The billionaire media mogul blew the roof off the Democratic National Convention, but she’s got jaw-dropping homes all across the country.

item.title: Valvoline Can Be a Slick Addition to Your Portfolio
item.description: With its transformation into a pure retail operation only last year, Valvoline is continuing to increase market share and efficiency.

item.title: Why Elon Musk is foreclosing on the former L.A. home of actor Gene Wilder
item.description: Elon Musk has moved to foreclose on a $13 million home after loaning Gene Wilder’s nephew millions to help him buy the iconic property.

item.title: How a Colorful Investor Profited From a Crypto Giant's Dealmaking
item.description: Christian Angermayer introduced Tether to companies in which he held stakes, and took cuts of some of the deals.

item.title: Uber fined $324 million by Dutch regulator over transfer of driver data to U.S.
item.description: The Dutch privacy regulator on Monday said it fined Uber Technologies 290 million euros ($324 million) for allegedly sending data on drivers to the U....
